In an instant, the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva can cause all sentient beings in the trichiliocosm to attain the path of the bodhisattva, each accomplishing the Dharma, and enjoy themselves with the sages, while causing other sentient beings to be unaware.

In an instant, Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas can cause the sentient beings in the trichiliocosm who have not yet established the power of the roots of virtue to simultaneously go forth and cultivate the unsurpassed holy life, shave their heads and beards, put on the three Dharma robes, carry the alms bowl in their hands, practice the twelve dharmas, go for alms at the right time to bless and deliver all, and sometimes sit in meditation contemplating the body. 'Today I will surely attain unsurpassed true enlightenment, there is no doubt. First I will move all worlds, and the sages who have attained spiritual powers will come to protect me, causing other sentient beings to be unaware of it.'
Furthermore, Maitreya!

In an instant, Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas can cause all sentient beings in the trichiliocosm to attain the path of bodhisattvas and turn the wheel of the Dharma, with the four noble truths as they are - the truth of suffering, the truth of its origin, the truth of its cessation, and the truth of the path. In an instant, Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas can cause all sentient beings in the trichiliocosm who have attained the bodhisattva path to enter the samÄdhi of the mind of intention, causing all mountains, rivers, cliffs, tiles, stones, and plants to transform into the seven treasures, providing for the poor and suffering, universally satisfying them, and then expounding the six pÄramitÄs, without the remaining sentient beings being aware of it.

In an instant, Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas can cause all sentient beings in the trichiliocosm to attain the bodhisattva path and enter the vajra samÄdhi, able to transform all into the color of gold, like the appearance of the Buddha without difference, causing them all to accomplish the unsurpassed path, without the other sentient beings being aware.
Furthermore, Maitreya!

In an instant, Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas can cause all sentient beings in the trichiliocosm to attain the bodhisattva path, and in the past, future, and present, attain the faculties, powers, and enlightenment of a buddha, discern emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and realize that all dharmas are nonexistent, without the other sentient beings being aware.

In this way, Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice the ten kinds of illuminating wisdom will surely attain the unsurpassed perfect true Way without doubt.
At that time, Maitreya addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
Now, having heard the true and correct teachings spoken by the TathÄgata, the Perfectly Enlightened One, I have a great awakening. I wish to enable sentient beings to attain this wisdom.
At that time, the chapter on the timely (14) Bodhisattva's Necklace Sutra, chapter 41 on the timely (14) At that time, Dharma SubhÅ«ti addressed the Buddha, saying:

How do bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas cultivate the unsurpassed true and correct path to attain perfect enlightenment, uphold dignified conduct and timely practices, and thus be able to perfect the great Dharma adornments?
The Buddha told Dharma SubhÅ«ti:

If there are bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who wish to perfect the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of a tathÄgata, and perfect the great Dharma adornments of a tathÄgata, they should cultivate the ten great Dharma adornments of wisdom, and thus be able to perfect the great Dharma adornments.
In this way, son of a great clan!
If there are good sons and good women who wish to hear the TathÄgata's great Dharma adornments and timely practices, listen carefully, listen carefully, and contemplate it well!
What are the ten?

It is said that the ten are: if a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva knows that the time has come and will attain unsurpassed perfect supreme enlightenment, he will not miss the opportunity to go to the foot of the bodhi tree, uphold the mind of great vows, and his mind will be like empty space, cutting off all thoughts. This is called the timely practice of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva.
Furthermore, Dharma-mi-mo!

If a bodhisattva further knows for himself that the time has come to transform those beings, and the surnames, given names, and clan names do not go beyond the realm, he must liberate all beings before he can attain certainty. This is called the timely practice of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva.
Furthermore, Dharma-mi-mo!

If a bodhisattva deeply knows for himself that he will now attain supreme perfect enlightenment, and will also bestow the prediction on bodhisattvas, in the lands and retinues in the directions, this is called the timely practice of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva.
Furthermore, Dharmodgata!

If a bodhisattva examines and knows for himself that he has now attained mastery over the various knowledges, and will cause sentient beings to be no different from himself, he will then enter there and teach and transform them, universally enabling sentient beings to attain this mastery and unobstructed Dharma. This is called the timely practice of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva.
Furthermore, Dharmodgata!

If a bodhisattva enters the gate of liberation and performs buddha-works, transforming all obstructed dharmas, causing them all to return to the inexhaustible treasury, and also causing sentient beings to attain what he has attained, this is called the timely practice of a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva.
Furthermore, Dharmodgata!

The bodhisattva carefully knows for himself, 'I have now attained the formless four concentrations and the four immeasurables of kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity, and I will use these concentrations to teach and transform sentient beings, enabling all to attain the same as I have.' This is called the timely practice of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva.
Furthermore, Dharmodgata!

If a bodhisattva carefully knows for himself, upholding dignified conduct without losing propriety, knowing when to walk and when to sit, diligently practicing day and night without contradicting the teachings, entering the city at the right time without looking left and right, benefiting sentient beings with immeasurable wisdom, and enabling sentient beings to attain the same as himself, this is called the timely practice of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva.
Furthermore, Dharmodgata!

If a bodhisattva carefully knows for himself, observing the fundamental capacities of sentient beings to be liberated or not, accepting their offerings of faith and eating in moderation, returning to a secluded place to sit or lie down and contemplate:

'The offerings I receive now are used to support the four elements, enabling me to practice the Way and attain supreme enlightenment. I will further use this Dharma to guide and transform all, universally enabling sentient beings to attain what I have attained.'
This is called the timely practice of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva.
Furthermore, Dharma SubhÅ«ti!

If a bodhisattva carefully knows himself, as I do today, he should follow the sages' precepts, guiding and transforming all without increase or decrease, gradually advancing into the five realms, observing their minds and intentions to liberate them.

Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who cultivate these ten wisdoms and practice them in a timely manner will attain the unsurpassed true path and perfect supreme enlightenment, and will then be able to fully possess the great Dharma adornments.
Chapter 42: The Ten Inconceivables (14) Bodhisattva Sutra of the Bodhisattva's Necklace, Chapter 42: The Ten Inconceivables At that time, Bodhisattva Son of the Victorious One said to the Buddha:
World-Honored One!

How do bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas enter the five paths, going back and forth, teaching and transforming sentient beings, purifying the Buddha-lands, and attaining unsurpassed perfect supreme enlightenment?
Do they practice the inconceivable great Dharma adornments?
The Buddha told Bodhisattva Son of the Victorious One:
Listen carefully, listen carefully, and consider it well!
If there are bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who wish to attain unsurpassed perfect supreme enlightenment and practice the inconceivable great Dharma adornments, they should cultivate ten dharmas.

If there are bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who enter the five destinies of birth and death to transform according to their kind, and who, sitting in one cross-legged posture, fill the buddha-lands in the ten directions, and further cause the sound to shake the worlds of the trichiliocosm, and in the midst of that teach and transform all sentient beings, causing them all to give rise to the intention for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, yet cause sentient beings to be unaware of it, this is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas' practice of the true Dharma that accords with the inconceivable.

Furthermore, son of the victorious one!

If a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva enters the five destinies to teach and transform sentient beings, in a single thought, a single instant, with a single dharma body, he universally fills the trichiliocosm, causing all sentient beings to universally hear and know, and causes all sentient beings to be replete with the dharma realm, yet those sentient beings do not know from where they hear it, and all give rise to the intention to achieve unsurpassable and perfect enlightenment, this is called a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva cultivating the true Dharma in accordance with the inconceivable.
Furthermore, son of the victorious one!

If a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva enters the five destinies and teaches sentient beings, using the power of spiritual penetrations to transform all sentient beings in the trichiliocosm into the form of a buddha, and they each teach each other the practice of the twelve ascetic deeds, and deliver immeasurable sentient beings,
yet those sentient beings do not know for themselves who is delivering them.
This is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's cultivation of the inconceivable true Dharma.
Furthermore, son of a great clan!

If a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva enters the five destinies and teaches sentient beings, using a single wisdom to discern all formless dharmas without obstruction, universally causing those with form to understand this essential truth and attain liberation.
If those sentient beings do not know for themselves, 'Who is delivering me today?'
This is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's cultivation of the inconceivable true Dharma.
Furthermore, son of a great clan!

If a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva enters the five realms to teach and transform sentient beings, in a single thought he is able to see all dharmas, discern the inconceivable practices of the dharma realm, and cause all sentient beings to hear this path's teachings, simultaneously attaining the path without obstruction.
Yet those sentient beings do not themselves realize from whom they heard it. This is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's cultivation of the true Dharma in accordance with the inconceivable.
Furthermore, son of the victorious one,

if a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva enters the five realms to teach and transform sentient beings, causing those sentient beings to all attain spiritual powers, to play in the immeasurable worlds of the ten directions, to hear the teachings of the buddhas of the ten directions, and to understand that all dharmas are like illusions and transformations,

Furthermore, son of the victorious one,

If a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva enters the five destinies and teaches and transforms sentient beings, causing all beings in the three times to attain perfect enlightenment and accomplish everything, this is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's cultivation of the true Dharma in accordance with the inconceivable.
Furthermore, son of the victorious one!

If a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva enters the five destinies and teaches and transforms sentient beings, entering the profound Dharma treasury and discerning wondrous wisdom, transcending the past, future, and present, alone treading the three realms without equal, and further causing sentient beings to be no different from oneself, this is called the bodhisattva-mahÄsattva's cultivation of the true Dharma in accordance with the inconceivable.
This is called, son of the victorious one!

The bodhisattva's five faculties, virtues, powers, entering the five destinies to teach and transform sentient beings, the superiority of the dharmas immeasurable, also not known by Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas.
Chapter 43: No-Self (14) Bodhisattva Necklace Sutra, Chapter 43 on No-Self At that time, there was a bodhisattva named Mind Wisdom who addressed the Buddha, saying:

What is called 'no-self' is ultimately reaching this, which is also no-self. Analyzing the four elements and contemplating their origins is also no-self. Not seeing the fundamental principle of the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« of the three times, the wisdom of non-attachment is also neither inside nor outside. Analyzing and contemplating all are non-existent. This is called the bodhisattva's practice of no-self.
The Buddha further told Mind Wisdom:

If good men and good women enter the concentration of emptiness and ultimately reach the profound Dharma treasury of the TathÄgata, which is neither here nor there, and understand that all are non-existent.
If good men and good women, with the power of spiritual penetrations, enter the concentration of concentration, illuminating all with the observation of signless dharmas.

The teachings of the buddhas and world-honored ones are used to transform and liberate all beings without relying on words and teachings. This is called signlessness.
What is meant by signlessness?

Chapter 44: The Equal Vehicle, from the Bodhisattva's Necklace Sutra, Chapter 44 on the Equal Vehicle. At that time, there was a bodhisattva in the assembly named Pure Eyes. Space has no good or evil, the Dharma realm is always pure,
Dharma is originally non-existent, how can there be defilement?
Not seeing the abandonment of wrong dharmas, cultivating the unsurpassed path,
And no inferior people, this is the characteristic of the Great Vehicle.
All dharmas are originally without characteristics, like space that cannot be grasped,
Seeking characteristics is originally empty, the wise should be aware of this.
If one wishes to practice unobstructed, skillful means is the foremost,
Fulfilling the wishes of sentient beings, leading them to the place of the Way.
Good friends are the true Dharma, firmly upholding without forgetting,
Forever leaving the aggregates, sense bases, and sense fields, not practicing to adjust the five hindrances and five obscurations.
If the Buddha appears in the world, or attains nirvana,
The true Dharma always exists, never changing.
All dharmas have correct realization, good and evil do not decay,
The nature of true reality is also like this, always abiding without moving.
The cultivation is extremely profound, with no attachment to the realm of demons,
All dharmas are also like this, forever free from the party of wrong views.
If one seeks the unsurpassed path, not attached to the Dharma of cultivation,
Neither with thought nor without thought, this accords with unobstructed wisdom.
The Buddha's wisdom is without attachment, the Dharma is Dharma without arising,
Without seeing the path of arising and cessation, this accords with the practice of the Great Vehicle.
Perhaps by giving one's head and eyes, with faithful mind nothing is discarded,
One does not see a recipient, with deluded thoughts nothing is attached to.
All dharmas are originally unborn, when investigated there are no lairs,
The characteristics of dharmas are also like this, their beginning cannot be seen.
If a person wishes to investigate emptiness, wishing to know its edge and shore,
Day and night, thinking and recollecting, in vain exhausting their efforts.
Foolishly attached to the self, calculating permanence, unable to be free from it,

The path of the true person and sages, the three penetrations without obstruction,
Still not exhausting the source of emptiness, how much more so for these kinds of people?

Generosity without attachment, wishing to seek the unsurpassed path,

Precepts without self-practice, peacefully abiding in the foremost Dharma,
Also without these characteristics, recollecting the practice of precepts, wisdom, and liberation.
Not cultivating and naturally attaining, wisdom eliminating the root of ignorance,
Precepts complete, the pure path, pure like the moon without defilements.
The body is like a bubble or foam, also like lightning passing before the eyes,
The mind faculty is like a mirage. Precepts are the path of purity.
The most supreme, without equal, the sage, the god among gods,
Cessation of the mind and all evil, tranquil concentration, the unsurpassed.

Cutting off one's limbs and body, one still does not give rise to evil thoughts,
Discerning internal and external matters, body and mind firmly abide.

From beginningless eons, transmigrating in the cycle of birth and death,
For the sake of a single being, personally donning the armor of great vows.
All dharmas are without arising or cessation, and also without the notion of destruction,
The deluded mind is inverted, not understanding the wisdom of the past.
The nature of the dharma realm is eternally abiding, those who study do not reach the ultimate,
One should understand the beginning and end, that what arises is without arising.
Beings do not deeply penetrate the subtle and unobstructed wisdom,
They should seek skillful means to remove the inverted mind.
The buddhas appear in the world, but those to be saved do not meet them,
And they do not abandon them either, but strengthen their courageous effort.
Discerning all dharmas as like an illusion, a mirage, or a flame,
Seeking the real, there is no fruition or retribution, like contemplating space without form.
Sentient beings do not contemplate carefully, but themselves give rise to defiled attachments,
Gradually showing them the teachings of the Way, causing them to know the place of non-action.
Skillfully contemplating this meaning, what is wished for will surely be attained,
Contemplating each and every thing, unobstructed wisdom is accomplished.
Contemplating the internal and external practices, seeking the nature of emptiness everywhere,
Without reliance, without attachment, the beginning and end of birth and death are pure.
Advancing in learning, delighting in solitude, alone without fear,
Contemplating meditation, concentration, and wisdom, skillfully progressing to the six supernormal powers.
